summary: Meta (NASDAQ:META) slips 1.11% as German court refuses to block AI trainingon Facebook and Instagram data . This follows March's rollout of Meta's AI chatbot service in Europe after a year-long delay .  Meta's AI roadmap and weigh on growth if enforcement tightens around user-data usage . This article first appeared on GuruFocus.com .

Meta Platforms said last month it would train its AI models in the European Union with public posts of adults across its platforms . Meta said at the time that its platforms' users in the EU would be notified of the project and given the opportunity to opt out .

Agilysys (NASDAQ:AGYS) offers a software-as-service platform that helps hotels, resorts, restaurants, and other hospitality businesses manage their operations and workflows . Revenue increased by 19.2% annually over the last three years, acceptable on an absolute basis but tepid for a software company enjoying secular tailwinds .  Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) operates a collection of the largest social networks in the world - Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger, along with its metaverse focused Reality Labs . The company's stock price of $102 implies a valuation ratio of 9.4x forward price-to-sales .  EMCOR (NYSE:EME) provides electrical, mechanical, and building construction and services . Annual revenue growth of 14.8% over the last two years was superb and indicates its market share increased during this cycle . At $636.57 per share, Meta trades at 14.4x forward EV/EBITDA .  Stocks have retraced as investors debate the health of the economy and the potential impact of tariffs . While this leaves much uncertainty around 2025, a few companies are poised for long-term gains regardless of the political or macroeconomic climate . This is a curated list of ourHigh Qualitystocks that have generated a market-beating return of 176% over the last five years .
